intro: Byrsocarpus baillonianus, commonly known as the Baillon's false mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its showy, pinkish-white flowers are typically borne in clusters at the leaf axils. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
